overview: New Year's Eve session focused on procrastination as a signal (not a failure), values-based planning, and the power of external support structures. Lizzy's 'last mile' problem and Stara's follow-up block sparked rich discussion about root causes and practical solutions.
topics_covered: Procrastination as a signal of misalignment with values
VIA Character Strengths and Values/Personality/Skills Venn diagram
Rick's daily planning system - plan tonight, execute tomorrow
Doug's first principles framework - values as personal first principles
Human Design for understanding energy patterns
Body doubling schedules and 'professional package' concept

member_checkins.name: Lizzy Summers
member_checkins.shared: Completes 90% of tasks but struggles with the final 10% - a phone call avoided since July, a $50/mo camp electricity bill left running.
member_checkins.challenge: Fear of the unknown after success, discomfort with being seen or praised
member_checkins.insight: Human Design chart shows 'starter' energy but lacks 'completion' gate - need collaboration to fill energy gaps
member_checkins.commitment: Finalize a product and create full marketing campaign

member_checkins.name: Stara Shakti
member_checkins.shared: Difficulty completing post-meeting tasks, like sending bio/headshot to Melissa for Jan 11 podcast.
member_checkins.challenge: High motivation from good meetings fades when facing solo administrative work
member_checkins.commitment: Send bio/headshot to Melissa, meet with Gio to sing and discuss collaboration

member_checkins.name: Gio
member_checkins.shared: Feeling directionless without the structure of flying, struggling with where to start each day.
member_checkins.challenge: Lack of structure leads to negative self-talk and binge-watching
member_checkins.insight: Sang with herself and remembered she enjoys it - 'I actually like doing this'
member_checkins.commitment: Review 'The Life You Were Born to Lead' to find a personal system

standout_moments.title: Rick's Daily Planning System
standout_moments.speaker: Rick Webster
standout_moments.description: Rick shared his system for overcoming the emotional paralysis of daily decisions by separating planning from execution.
the_framework: Plan the next day TONIGHT - make decisions intellectually, not emotionally
Calendar EVERYTHING - including non-work items like exercise
Align with values - hold all activities against core values to avoid resentment
Separate thinking modes: outcome-based (the 'summit') for planning, action-based (the 'next step') for doing
key_quotes: When you wake up, you're not making decisions - you're just following the plan you made last night.

group_response.speaker: Gio
group_response.reaction: Asked for literal instruction on how to do this - 'I kind of need something like that'

group_response.speaker: Lizzy Summers
group_response.reaction: Connected it to her need for structure despite non-traditional career path

standout_moments.ripple: Sparked discussion about body doubling as external support for execution

standout_moments.title: Doug's First Principles Framework
standout_moments.speaker: Doug Snyder
standout_moments.description: Doug introduced first principles thinking as a way to connect daily actions to fundamental truths about what matters.
the_framework: Break a problem down to its fundamental truths, free from assumptions
When actions align with values, motivation and agency increase
Misalignment creates the feeling of procrastination
key_quotes: Values are your first principles. When you're aligned, you don't need willpower.

group_response.speaker: Lizzy Summers
group_response.reaction: Connected to her realization that half the stuff in her head isn't hers

standout_moments.title: Lizzy's Brain-Sweep Practice
standout_moments.speaker: Lizzy Summers
standout_moments.description: Lizzy shared the 'Crappy Childhood Fairy' journaling practice for clearing mental debris.
the_framework: Purpose: 'Sweep the brain' to gain clarity on true priorities
key_quotes: I came to the realization that half of the stuff that's going on in my head isn't mine.

group_response.speaker: Gio
group_response.reaction: Asked for more details - 'What does that process look like? Is it a book?'

standout_moments.ripple: Gio noted wanting to get back to 'safety and nervous system regulation' - connecting Lizzy's practice to Jasmine's framework from previous session

themes.name: Procrastination as Signal
themes.description: Procrastination and overwhelm aren't failures - they're signals of misalignment with core values, indicating a need to pause and reassess.

themes.name: Values as Compass
themes.description: Use values clarity (VIA assessment, first principles) to make choices that feel empowering rather than draining.

themes.name: External Structure for Internal Chaos
themes.description: Body doubling, pre-made packages, and evening planning provide external scaffolding when internal motivation wavers.

commitments.action: Finalize a product and create full marketing campaign (blog, email, social media)
Send bio/headshot to Melissa for Jan 11 podcast
Meet with Gio to sing and discuss potential collaboration
Review 'The Life You Were Born to Lead' to find a personal system
Create private Mighty Networks section for shared resources

announcements.content: Body doubling schedule: M-F 7:30-8:30 AM PT; Tue/Wed/Fri 10:00-11:30 AM PT; Mon/Thu 5:00-7:00 PM PT
